title: U.S. says embassy staff in Israel who want to leave should do so immediately
desc: The U.S. Embassy in Israel on Friday told its staff that it could leave the country and urged anyone considering departure to do so immediately, as the threat of an American strike on Iran looms.

desc: Jupiter, Saturn, Venus, Mercury, Neptune and Uranus will all be visible at same time in curved line across sky

title: SpaceX Crew-12 is in the ISS
desc: For several years, NASA has been partnering with SpaceX, using their reusable rockets to put new astronauts in space, including the Falcon 9 rocket and the Dragon spacecraft. title: How Hollywood Is Looking for the Next ‘Heated Rivalry’
desc: Execs across Hollywood spent this winter buzzing about ‘Heated Rivalry,’ trying to understand what made it connect with audiences so quickly — and how to replicate that success.

title: Uganda Must Build the Light Before Transitioning: Expert urges against symbolic renewables
desc: Kampala, Uganda | THE INDEPENDENT | One of the leading European sustainability experts, Arshad Rab, has stated that Uganda cannot follow the conventional “energy transition” path of developed nations. title: Artemis 2 moon rocket rolls back to the shop photo of the day Feb. 27, 2026
desc: NASA brought its mega moon rocket back into the shop for repairs on Feb. 25, 2026, just as the sun was setting over the Florida Space Coast.

title: Ghanaian Prisoners of War in Ukraine: How they got there and their plea
desc: Two Ghanaian prisoners of war being held in Ukraine have appealed for forgiveness over their involvement in the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine.
